data.title: Greg Davis, MD, MPH
data.meta_description: Dr. Greg Davis is an otolaryngologist & rhinologist serving patients in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, & Alaska. Schedule a consultation.
data.text:
Dr. Davis is a Seattle native who attended the University of Washington for his undergraduate education, medical school, and otolaryngology surgical residency.

After completing his training, he practiced at the University of Washington Medical Center for 12 years. There, he served as the Director of Rhinology and Endoscopic Skull Base Surgery and founded and directed the neurorhinology endoscopic skull base surgery sub-specialty training fellowship. During this time there, he cared for patients from around the region who had the most complex and challenging sinus and skull base disorders.

He left his academic position at the University of Washington to focus on the most enjoyable aspect of his medical practice: treating patients. Being part of a private practice in Puyallup allows him to provide the highest quality medical and surgical care in a very convenient environment for patients. No matter how simple or complex your condition, Dr. Davis treats all his patients with considerable care, kindness, and respect.

Dr. Davis has also been the recipient of several awards for excellence in patient care, including the “Top Doc” Award from Seattle Met Magazine for the years 2011-2019, Seattle Magazine from 2019-2022, Castle Connolly Top Doc Awards, the American Academy of Otolaryngology’s “Honors Award”, and the “Patient Top Choice” Award from Vitals.com.

He is a physician, educator, and co-director of the American Rhinologic Society’s Summer Sinus Symposium. He also co-directs the annual Seattle Otology and Advanced Rhinology Course. Dr. Davis is on the Board of Directors for the ARS. He is also a past-president of the Northwest Academy of Otolaryngology. Over the years, he has given numerous national and international lectures on improving medical and surgical treatment of sinus disorders.

Dr. Davis is married and has two adult children. He enjoys traveling, skiing, scuba diving, hiking, rock climbing, mountaineering, and camping.
